Dear BTS,
I am an ARMY from Hong Kong. I am so sorry to bother you. But please please please read my words. I am diagnosed with bone cancer. My condition is really critical right now coz' the tumor had already spread to different parts of my body. Writing to all members in BTS is one of the items in my bucket list. 

I never knew that music can be powerful until I met you in 2017. At that time i was depressed because of the academic stress and some family issues. I heard that Taehyung was ranked no.1 in the 100 most handsome guy in the world (btw congrats to Jungkook in 2019!). Out of curiosity, I searched his name and found BTS. I started to get really interested into BTS and bought the first-ever CD in my life. I listened to your song when I feel depressed and frustrated. You asked me not to give up in Not Today. You told me how not to be disturbed by haters in a lot of songs. You told me to cheer up even though my life is gloomy in Tomorrow. Gradually, I started to feel less depressed and feel hopeful in life. You are gorgeous, like the stars in the sky. I wanted to be as excellent as you are. Because of you, I studied hard and went to the University.

As an ARMY, I always wish to see you in person, I had already decided to go to your concert in 2019 in Hong Kong. But sadly I discovered that I had a tumor on my left knee in the end of 2018 and need to be hospitalised to treat my cancer. During the chemotherapy, I kept listening to all your songs. Your words are powerful, giving me enough warmth and courage to go through all these hard times. I was optimistic, wishing that I would recover and go see you in the future. 

But unfortunately, I canâ€™t now. The doctors told me that the tumor had already spread to different parts of my body. No surgery, chemotherapy or medication can help with my situation now. If no miracle exists, I would leave this world soon. Donâ€™t be too sad when I leave. I am not alone now.

I just want to tell you to stay focused on your path. Donâ€™t get bothered by the haters or rumours. You are precious. Your music has changed my life and the life of the others. You have shown me I have reasons I should love myself. Thank you for being BTS. Thank you for bringing to me so much joy and happiness. 

Chloe Fan
